intro: Erodium botrys var. luxurians, commonly known as the clustered filaree, is a flowering plant in the family Geraniaceae. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces tiny, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in gardens and along roadsides. Its botanical features make it a common weed in temperate regions.
